paper_summary.title: Bayesian Chronology Construction and Substance Time

comprehensibility.justification: Explanatory claims explicitly stated, theoretical framework clear, inference logic transparent. Minor gaps in implicit protocol documentation.

transparency.justification: Framework explicitly stated, alternatives documented, reasoning traceable. Supplement lacks independent DOI; three implicit protocols.

plausibility.justification: Framework coherent with domain knowledge, builds on established Allen's interval algebra and Bayesian chronology. No ad hoc assumptions.

validity.justification: Mathematical derivations rigorous, case study demonstrates method. Case study is illustrative rather than validating (no ground truth).

robustness.justification: MCMC stability tested with 5 runs. Single analytical framework, no sensitivity testing. Appropriate for framework-introducing paper.

generalisability.justification: Scope explicitly constrained as 'starting discussion of best practices'. Case study appropriately framed as illustrative.

reproducibility.justification: ArchaeoPhases on CRAN, OxCal model in supplement, data from ADS with DOI. Supplement lacks independent DOI; partial environment specification.

key_strengths: Clear theoretical contribution distinguishing event time from substance time
Rigorous mathematical framework with Allen's interval algebra
Excellent transparency with 8 methods and 10 protocols documented
Strong infrastructure: 100% ORCID coverage, CRAN package, ADS data with DOI
Appropriate scope constraint as framework introduction
key_limitations: Case study is illustrative, not validating (no ground truth comparison)
Moderate robustness (single framework, no sensitivity testing)
Three implicit protocols (similarity estimation, transformation/reticulation inference)
Mixed software dependencies (OxCal proprietary, R open source)

for_users: Document similarity estimation procedures explicitly when applying method
Consider sensitivity analysis for mode inference thresholds
Archive code and data in stable repositories with DOIs
for_reproduction: Contact authors for clarification on implicit protocols if needed
